title: Bug 4964: Automatic Code Assist needs to be smarter
description: Since the option 'DISPOSED' is first in the list and selected, I ended up with 'button.DISPOSED', which is not what I intended. I had to delete it and start again. Code assist should recognize that I have typed '(' and suggest 'dispose()' instead of 'DISPOSED'. Alternatively, code assist should be case sensitive when automatically inserting code.
OB: While writing SWT code, I type the following: button.dispose. At this point, I do not realize that the code assist list is up because I am not looking.
EB: When I type 'button.dispose', the code assist should suggest 'dispose()' instead of 'DISPOSED'.
SR:
1. Open Build 204
2. Write SWT code
3. Type 'button.dispose' without looking at the code assist list
